sect1.title: about this manual
sect1.para: Bluefish has a large feature set, allowing the user to customize the editing experience in different ways. This manual aim to present the novice user with a starting point for mastering Bluefish. The advanced user will find the more advanced features thoroughly documented in this manual.
The manual starts off by describing how to install Bluefish, along with requirements and supported platforms.

The next chapter, the tutorial, is highly recommended for the novice user. It will present a step-by-step introduction to the main features of Bluefish, aiming to supply a short description of the most used features.
The rest of the manual contains a complete feature reference, from basic to advanced features.
As a reference to the Bluefish developers and anyone interested in contributing code, the manual also contains guidelines for the Bluefish source.

sect1.title: what is bluefish?
sect1.para: Bluefish is a powerful editor for experienced web designers and programmers. Bluefish supports many programming and markup languages, but it focuses on editing dynamic and interactive websites.

Bluefish is a WYSIWYM
What You See Is What You Mean text editor, letting you, the programmer, stay in full control over the code by editing it by hand. To alleviate the editing process, a large number of features are at your disposal. Numerous methods for inserting markup and code exists, through toolbars, dialogs and predefined and user customized menus. Syntax highlighting, advanced search and replace functionality, scalability and language function references make Bluefish a powerful tool.

sect2.title: history of bluefish
sect2.para: Several years has passed since the first Bluefish release. In that time, the fish has gained a reputation for being an excellent editor, with qualities like stability, usability and numerous features. Also, Bluefish is small and needs only GTK2 to function, making it usable even on slow machines.

sect2.title: main features of bluefish
sect2.para: Bluefish has many features, this list will give you an overview of the most important or outstanding features.

Multiple document interface, will easily open 500+ documents (tested 3500 with documents simultaneously).

Multiple encodings support, can convert between different character sets, supports multibyte characters, unicode, UTF8 etc.

User-customizable toolbar for quick access to often used functions

User customizable integration of many programs, including weblint, tidy, make, javac etc. etc.

XML based function reference. Currently, references exist for HTML and PHP. Additions like GTK, Perl and Python will be added. You may also create your own function reference. The XML-format is described later in the manual.

sect2.title: how stable is bluefish?
sect2.para: The Bluefish developers aim to produce code that neither crash nor leak memory. Of course, that's not always easy to do, but we do try to minimize the damage. Leaks and crashes are often fixed in CVS as soon as they're discovered and hunted down. The developers use the Bluefish for their daily work, in addition to a large amount of users. Some nags do still exist, one problem is slightly slow copy/pasting.
For an updated list of open bugs, please visit the todo-list on the Bluefish WiKi, at http://bfwiki.tellefsen.net/?pagename=ToDoList.
We appreciate any and all contributions! Please do tell us if Bluefish crashes on you :-).
